title: Alexander De Croo - Wikipedia
snippet: Alexander De Croo (Dutch: [aːlɛkˈsɑndər də ˈkroː]; born 3 November 1975) is a Belgian politician and businessman who serves as Administrator of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP). He was Prime Minister of Belgium from 2020 to 2025. Previously from 2012 to 2020, De Croo ...

title: From Business Leader to Belgian Prime Minister | Spring/Summer 2021 Kellogg Magazine
snippet: Ultimately, De Croo could not resist the pull of politics, and he is now 12 years into a political career. In October 2020, De Croo assumed the highest office in Belgium, becoming the country’s prime minister.

title: A Fireside Chat with Alexander De Croo, Former Prime Minister of Belgium | Princeton School of Public and International Affairs
snippet: Alexander De Croo served as Prime Minister of Belgium from October 2020 until February 2025. Prior to his premiership, he held several key roles in the federal government, including Deputy Prime Minister from 2012 to 2020 and Minister of Finance ...

title: Alexander De Croo - Agenda Contributor | World Economic Forum
snippet: Dec 2025–now: Administrator, United Nations Development Fund; Feb 2025–Nov 2025: Member of Parliament, Belgium; 2020–Feb 2025: Prime Minister of Belgium; 2018–2020: Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of Finance and Development Cooperation; ...

title: H.E. Mr. Alexander De Croo | Generation Unlimited
snippet: H.E. Alexander De Croo is the current Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Belgium. Prime Minister De Croo has had a long and outstanding career in business and politics.
